channel.title: TGaceAllStories
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from TGaceAllStories, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: More than $125 million is stolen every year on Zelle. The feds say little is done to stop it.
item.description: A lawsuit filed by the CFPB says Zelle and the big banks that own it left the platform vulnerable to fraud in an effort to rush it to market to compet...

item.title: Tesla reverses losses to turn higher in a volatile week for the EV stock
item.description: Tesla on Friday reversed losses from earlier in the day to trade higher, putting the electric vehicle maker's stock on track to post a weekly gain.

item.title: What a government shutdown could mean for air travel
item.description: A government shutdown could mean thousands of air traffic controllers and TSA agents would go without paychecks.

item.title: Starbucks baristas strike in three U.S. cities during pre-Christmas rush
item.description: Starbucks baristas are striking in Los Angeles, Chicago and Seattle.

item.title: Biden pulls the plug on mass student-debt cancellation after rushing $4.28 billion in relief
item.description: Tens of thousands of public servants will have $4.28 billion in student debt canceled, the Biden administration announced Friday.

item.title: Key Fed inflation measure shows 2.4% rate in November, lower than expected
item.description: The PCE price index was expected to show a 2.5% annual inflation rate in November after rising 0.2% monthly.

item.title: Government shutdown live updates: Congress scrambles to reach spending deal before Saturday
Dow bounces 800 points Friday on encouraging inflation data after rough week: Live updates
item.description: All three major averages were still on track for sharp losses on the week.

item.title: Forget the 4% rule. Consider this new magic number for retirement withdrawals instead.

item.title: From Nike to Intel, CEO departures at U.S. companies hit a record this year
item.description: CEO exits at U.S. public companies were a record in 2024 as they faced competitive and strategic challenges.
